Issues.Title: Promise.prototype.then called on incompatible receiver in Chrome 77.0.3865.90
Issues.Body:
# üêû bug report ### Affected Package The issue is caused by package zone.js Maybe. ### Is this a regression? Actually angular is not broken, but a browser update broke the frameworks behavior. It's still working in all other browsers expect Chrome 77.0.3865.90 ### Description In Chrome 77.0.3865.90 in some case the following error is thrown for Promises around ReadableStream, WritableStream or TransferableStream, but I couldn;t come up with a simple reproduction. It was working fine until the most recent Chrome patch. ``` TypeError: Method Promise.prototype.then called on incompatible receiver [object Object] at ZoneAwarePromise.then () ``` ## üî¨ Minimal Reproduction https://github.com/zaenk/chrome77-zonejs-promise-bug Prereq: node 10 or 12, npm 3.11+, ng cli 8.3.5 * Clone the repo * npm install * ng serve * Open localhost:4200 in an updated Chrome Stable channel (77.0.3865.90) * F12 for console, observe the error message * If it not breaks for the first time, give the dev server and the browser some restart ## üî• Exception or Error 

TypeError: Method Promise.prototype.then called on incompatible receiver [object Object]
    at ZoneAwarePromise.then ()

Issues.Title: PWA App showing white screen due to very slow load on cold start
Issues.Body:
Hi, this is a very complex issue to describe, so I try my best to explain it in full details: We have an PWA app written in Angular, using Angular Service Worker package for PWA functionality. Recently we have noticed via Google Analytics that our page loads has gone too high and users complaining about our PWA app not loading (or very slow loading) in their desktop systems.

So, we investigated this issue and could reproduce it under certain conditions; We found out that it's not something related to our code, because many similar projects with the same library (Angular+ServiceWorker) also have this problem and it does not really matter which version of Angular packages you use, I tried 6, 7, 8 and also 9, but with the same result. Here are some url with Angular PWA demos on it which have the same issue:

https://firestarter-96e46.firebaseapp.com
https://angular-pwa-38ba5.firebaseapp.com
https://pwa.ng

So, these are steps to reproduce this issue on Chrome 76 & 77 (These two versions are the ones I could reproduce on them, Chrome 70 seems to work just fine and I guess this issue started in Chrome 75 or 76):

1. Go to the given URL (Desktop only, not mobile).
2. Click Install button on address bar for installing the PWA app.
3. Close all chrome windows and processes (**Important**)
4. Run PWA app by clicking it's icon on the desktop
5. Window pops up, but with no content, just a white screen.

This is very confusing, Because if you have any chrome window opened before opening the app, it works just fine. That's what makes step 3 so important in reproducing the issue and for having a so-called cold start effect on app start-up.

I tried other PWA apps that were written using Google WorkBox library, and they didn't had this issue. I guess this is somehow related to Angular ServiceWorker implementation causing some conflict with Chrome recent versions. I'm sure this is not something related to our code or even Angular, because it used to work just fine with older chrome versions. I Also submitted this issue on chromium issue tracker, but decided to also submit it in here to see if anyone else has this problem?

Possible Workaround:
After a lot of trial & errors, I noticed that if I put an async script tag in the end of head tag in my index.html, page renders fine, although page loading is still in progress for about 4-5 minutes without any specific reason and then window.load fires.

This is a very frustrating issue and we're losing our customers because of it. I hope and really appreciate if someone could shed some lights on it?
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "PWA App showing white screen due to very slow load on cold start" (#32800)

Issues.Title: Use Node.js async hooks to support Zone.js
Issues.Body:
# üöÄ feature request

### Relevant Package

Zone.js

### Description

Zone.js is incompatible with ES2017. Seeing as it is already 2019....it seems time to address this.

### Describe the solution you'd like

Node.js offers the async-hooks API which could support this on that platform.

@JiaLiPassion worked on this a couple years ago in the old repo. https://github.com/angular/zone.js/pull/795

As far as I know, there's no fundamental blocker.

### Describe alternatives you've considered

Don't use ES2017.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "Use Node.js async hooks to support Zone.js" (#32796)

Issues.Title: Ivy tree shakes entry components
Issues.Body:
# üêû bug report ### Affected Package Angular Ivy compiler in AOT mode ### Is this a regression? Yes, this works in non-ivy AOT builds ### Description I have ngModules that contain `entryComponents` like so: ```typescript @NgModule({ declarations: [PageLayoutComponent], imports: [CommonModule, WchNgComponentsModule], entryComponents: [PageLayoutComponent] }) export class PageLayoutModule { } ``` When adding this module to my application module, the `PageLayoutComponent` component will be part of the final bundle, no matter whether its is referenced by a template, a route or the bootstrap process. This works for both AOT and JIT mode. With Ivy enabled this is **not** the case, the component is NOT part of the final bundle, despite the fact that it is referenced as an entry component. In JIT mode the component is included, in AOT mode it is not. For my usecase this is a problem because I am attaching a custom decorator to the component and I expect this decorator to execute when the module is loaded. This in turn is done to be able to dynamically instantiate these components without having to reference them explicitly, the custom decorator registers the components. ## üåç Your Environment **Angular Version:**

Node: 10.16.3

Issues.Title: EmailValidator allows for e-mails without a period
Issues.Body:
# üêû bug report ### Affected Package The built in EmailValidator doesn't invalidate an e-mail address without a period. Package: angular/packages/forms/src/validators.ts ### Is this a regression? I went trough the changelog and I only found 2 items concerning the e-mail validator. One is when the e-mail validator was added to the framework and one to allow an empty field to not be treated as an invalid e-mail address. ### Description When used in a form an e-mail address like `foo@bar` is considered a valid e-mail address, which is of course not the case. ## üî¨ Minimal Reproduction https://stackblitz.com/edit/angular-email-validator-bug ## üî• Exception or Error ## üåç Your Environment **Angular Version:**

Issues.Title: fix(ivy): include `ngProjectAs` into attributes array
Issues.Body:
Prior to this commit, the `ngProjectAs` attribute was only included with a special flag and in a parsed format. As a result, projected node was missing `ngProjectAs` attribute as well as other attributes added after `ngProjectAs` one. This is problematic since app code might rely on the presence of `ngProjectAs` attribute (for example in CSS). This commit fixes the problem by including `ngProjectAs` into attributes array as a regular attribute and also makes sure that the parsed version of the `ngProjectAs` attribute with a special marker is added after regular attributes (thus we set them correctly at runtime). This change also aligns View Engine and Ivy behavior.

This PR resolves FW-1562.

Issues.Title: feat(language-service): allow retreiving synchronized analyzed NgModules
Issues.Body:
Sometimes modules retreived from the language service need to be
synchronized to the last time they were updated, and not updated
on-the-fly. This PR adds a flag to
`TypeScriptServiceHost#getAnalyzedModules` that retreives cached
analyzed NgModules rather than potentially recomputing them.

Issues.Title: ng update @angular/core@next removes options for @ViewChild
Issues.Body:
# üêû Bug report ### Command (mark with an `x`) ``` - [ ] new - [ ] build - [ ] serve - [ ] test - [ ] e2e - [ ] generate - [ ] add - [x ] update - [ ] lint - [ ] xi18n - [ ] run - [ ] config - [ ] help - [ ] version - [ ] doc ``` ### Is this a regression? I think this is a regression on the "Dynamic queries migration" that did work correctly in the v7 to v8 migration, but gives an incorrect change in the v8 to v9 migration ### Description `ng update @angular/cli@next` (in this case v9,0.0-next.7) causes options on `@ViewChild` to be removed, this causes TS errors. I noticed that this only occurs in usages of `@ViewChild` where `ng upgrade --from=7 --to=8` failed to automatically infer the correct option for the `static` property ## üî¨ Minimal Reproduction Create an application with a component that has a property annotated with `@ViewChild('something',{static: false})` that is not used anywhere. This way `ng update` cannot infer the value for `static` Run the `ng update @angular/core --from 8.0.0 --to 9.0.0 --migrate-only` ## üî• Exception or Error When compiling: 

error TS2554: Expected 2 arguments, but got 1.

Issues.Title: "ng serve" shows compilation successful but browser does not show angular app
Issues.Body:
I am using AWS EC2 ubuntu server, have installed a fresh angular app, run the `ng serve` command on putty from my Windows 7 PC.
**Result on CLI (in putty):** Compilation is successful.
**Problem:** URL is not accessible via browser whether I type it manually with ip and port 8080 as I used in my app or use `-o` with my command. Even if I add `--host 0.0.0.0` or `port` with my `ng serve` command. Neither approach worked out.

**Approaches tried:** 
- Added `--host 0.0.0.0` with `ng serve` command.
- I've checked firewall settings to enable access to node and putty.
- Updated host to "0.0.0.0" in my package.json file.

Please suggest what error there could be? If you have any question further or need any clarification or screenshot, I may also clarify/attach as per request/requirement.

Kindly respond with your solutions/suggestions..

**Edit (Sept 20, 2019, 22:44): **
I've checked out the following threads but neither have any solution devised. 
[https://github.com/angular/angular-cli/issues/7119](https://github.com/angular/angular-cli/issues/7119)
[https://github.com/angular/angular-cli/issues/6779](https://github.com/angular/angular-cli/issues/6779)

@alan-agius4 @filipesilva @mgechev @filipemelo  any thoughts from your side?

Issues.Title: Server build in Angular 9 isn't generating an ngfactory
Issues.Body:
# üêû Bug report ### Command (mark with an `x`) ``` - [ ] new - [ ] build - [ ] serve - [ ] test - [ ] e2e - [ ] generate - [ ] add - [ ] update - [ ] lint - [ ] xi18n - [ ] run - [ ] config - [ ] help - [ ] version - [ ] doc - [x] server ``` ### Is this a regression? Yes, the previous version in which this bug was not present was: 8 ### Description When upgrading an Angular 8 workspace that uses server-side rendering, it looks like `@angular-devkit/build-angular:server` isn't generating an `NgModuleFactory`. I don't know, I haven't tried old ones. ### Description Running `ng build --prod` when include my module I get the following error: ``` ERROR in ./node_modules/my-dream-app/dist/pablo-pagination/pablo-pagination.ngfactory.js Module not found: Error: Can't resolve 'pablo-pagination' in '/angular-module/my-dream-app2/node_modules/my-dream-app/dist/pablo-pagination' ERROR in ./src/app/app.module.ngfactory.js Module not found: Error: Can't resolve 'pablo-pagination' in '/angular-module/my-dream-app2/src/app' ERROR in ./src/app/app.component.ngfactory.js Module not found: Error: Can't resolve 'pablo-pagination' in '/angular-module/my-dream-app2/src/app' ``` ## üî¨ Minimal Reproduction ``` $ ng new my-dream-app $ ng generate library pablo-pagination // to include the library as external module $ ng new my-dream-app2 // need to do this so don't get error in browser // my-dream-app2/tsconfig.json "paths": { "@angular/*": [ "node_modules/@angular/*" ], } // and call the module as package "my-dream-app": "file:../my-dream-app", npm install // import the package inside app.module imports: [ PabloPaginationModule ], // this will be ok npm start // this will crash // ng build --prod ``` [Here you can have the two projects](https://github.com/rochapablo/angular-module-error) ## üî• Exception or Error

Issues.Title: deployUrl only changes index.html
Issues.Body:
# üêû Bug report ### Command (mark with an `x`) ``` - [ ] new - [x] build - [ ] serve - [ ] test - [ ] e2e - [ ] generate - [ ] add - [ ] update - [ ] lint - [ ] xi18n - [ ] run - [ ] config - [ ] help - [ ] version - [ ] doc ``` ### Is this a regression? No ### Description Set `angular.json => projects.name.architect.build.options.deployUrl = "/build/"`. My expectation is 1) all entries of .js/.css files build are changed to /build/ prefix. 2) all built .js/.css files are moved into %build_root%/build/ folder. The point 1) is true; the point 2) however, is false, all scripts are left in %build_root% folder. Basically, this breaks the app since it will try to load scripts from void. ## üî¨ Minimal Reproduction Just set deployUrl to something meaningful in angular.json. Then build the project `ng build --prod` and check the result ‚Äì¬†paths in index.html are changed, but files are left in the build root. ## üî• Exception or Error 

No errors thrown.

Issues.Title: Angular 8 prod build with aot asks sudo password
Issues.Body:
# üêû Bug report

### Command (mark with an `x`)
```
- [x] build
```
### Description

In linux server when we were doing build without aot (setting aot, buildOtpimizer to false) build was generating fine. 
After we set aot & buildOptimizer & generate build it asks for sudo password after compilation & it stays only for several seconds. If we fail to enter pwd in this time it exits.

## üî¨ Minimal Reproduction

It happened on linux server. I am not sure why build process is changing files permission after creating it.

```
"scripts": {
    "ng": "ng",
    "start": "ng serve",
    "build": "ng build",
    "gzipper": "gzipper",
    "build:prod": "node --max_old_space_size=2048 node_modules/@angular/cli/bin/ng build --prod && gzipper ./dist",
    "test": "ng test",
    "lint": "ng lint",
    "e2e": "ng e2e"
  }
```
User is using `npm run build:prod` to generate build.

## üî• Error

Below is screenshot when process exit before we could enter password.

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/25152577/65320305-30794080-dbbf-11e9-85fa-1ba832a7633a.png)

And this is when i was able to password and enter

![image (1)](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/25152577/65320374-5272c300-dbbf-11e9-8272-676cafd1c007.png)

## üåç Your Environment
```
 "devDependencies": {
    "@angular-devkit/build-angular": "~0.803.2",
    "@angular/cli": "~8.3.2",
    "@angular/compiler-cli": "~8.2.4",
    "@angular/language-service": "~8.2.4"
}
```
This is compiler & build versions used in project.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "Angular 8 prod build with aot asks sudo password" (#15641)

Issues.Title: `lint` should not show warnings when passing multiples `--files`
Issues.Body:
# üêû Bug report ### Command (mark with an `x`) ``` - [x] lint ``` ### Is this a regression? AFAIK it's always been that way. ### Description The `lint` command will output warning messages when passing multiple files. I expect to see no warning at all when the command is used as it was intended. This directly related to https://github.com/angular/angular-cli/issues/7612#issuecomment-505893948 ## üî¨ Minimal Reproduction Create a new project from scratch and run lint with two (or more) specific files: ```sh ng new app # accepts all default values cd app ng lint --files=src/app/app.component.ts --files=src/app/app.module.ts ``` ## üî• Exception or Error The output will be: ``` Option "files" was already specified with value ["src/app/app.component.ts"]. The new value ["src/app/app.component.ts","src/app/app.module.ts"] will override it. Linting "app"... All files pass linting. ``` But I expected it to be: ``` Linting "app"... All files pass linting. ``` ## üåç Your Environment

Issues.Title: feat(@angular-devkit/architect): support accessing project metadata
Issues.Body:
This eliminates the need to manually read a workspace file and removes the use of the experimental workspace API from the `@angular-devkit/build-angular` package.

The `BuilderContext` now provides a `getProjectMetadata` function that provides the `root`, `sourceRoot`, `prefix`, and any custom extension fields from the project definition within `angular.json`.

Issues.Title: Ivy marks unassigned but used child interfaces as unused with compiler warning.
Issues.Body:
# üêû Bug report ### Command (mark with an `x`) ``` - [ x] new - [ x] build - [ x] serve ``` ### Is this a regression? Yes ### Description Ivy incorrectly identifies interfaces as unused that compose parts of an object returned from an API endpoint. i.e. Type A that contains Type B, if Type B is never assigned to and is in it's own TS file, Ivy generates warnings that Type B is not an entry point. ### Workarounds: - Move the interface into the same file as the parent object interface. - Inline the child interface into the parent interface rather than defining a new type. - Define A.B as \ rather than strongly typing it. ## üî¨ Minimal Reproduction https://github.com/fivedice/ivy-warnings See the ReadMe.md for specific example in the repo. ## üî• Exception or Error 

WARNING in /Users/jyoutsey/src/fivedice/ivy-warnings/src/app/currency.ts is part of the TypeScript compilation but it's unused.
Add only entry points to the 'files' or 'include' properties in your tsconfig.

WARNING in /Users/jyoutsey/src/fivedice/ivy-warnings/src/environments/environment.prod.ts is part of the TypeScript compilation but it's unused.
Add only entry points to the 'files' or 'include' properties in your tsconfig.
## üåç Your Environment 

Angular CLI: 9.0.0-next.4
Node: 10.16.0
OS: darwin x64
Angular: 9.0.0-next.6

Issues.Title: older (es5) browsers not fully supported when using workspace scripts
Issues.Body:
# üêû Bug report ### Command ``` - [ ] new - [x] build - [ ] serve - [ ] test - [ ] e2e - [ ] generate - [ ] add - [ ] update - [ ] lint - [ ] xi18n - [ ] run - [ ] config - [ ] help - [ ] version - [ ] doc ``` ### Is this a regression? Yes, the previous version I'm aware this was still working was 8.0. ### Description Since I upgraded the cli to 8.3.3 my applications do not provide support for older browsers such as IE11. ## üî¨ Minimal Reproduction 1. Create a new project. ``` npx -p @angular/cli@8.3.3 ng new es5-support ``` 2. Change the browsers list file to consider IE 9-11 (remove `not` as suggested in the comments): ``` > 0.5% last 2 versions Firefox ESR not dead IE 9-11 ``` 3. Create a custom script that uses, for example, Promises: ``` const myPromise = new Promise(function(resolve) { setTimeout(function(){ resolve('Promise resolved'); }, 500); }); myPromise.then(console.log); ``` 4. Add this script to the build target (angular.json): ``` ... "architect": { "build": { "builder": "@angular-devkit/build-angular:browser", "options": { "outputPath": "dist/es5-support", "index": "src/index.html", "main": "src/main.ts", "polyfills": "src/polyfills.ts", "tsConfig": "tsconfig.app.json", "aot": false, "assets": [ "src/favicon.ico", "src/assets" ], "styles": [ "src/styles.css" ], "scripts": [ "my-script.js" ] }, ... ``` 5. Build the application: ``` ng build --prod ``` 6. Deploy and run the application on IE11. Here is a repo that reproduces the error: https://github.com/cladera/ng-cli-es5-support ## üî• Exception or Error 

SCRIPT5009: 'Promise' is undefined
File: scripts.31a5e5bdf3ecf1f1be1c.js, Line: 1, Column: 1
## üåç Your Environment 

Angular CLI: 8.3.4
Node: 12.3.1
OS: darwin x64
Angular: 8.2.6
... animations, common, compiler, compiler-cli, core, forms
... language-service, platform-browser, platform-browser-dynamic
... router

Package                           Version
-----------------------------------------------------------
@angular-devkit/architect         0.803.4
@angular-devkit/build-angular     0.803.4
@angular-devkit/build-optimizer   0.803.4
@angular-devkit/build-webpack     0.803.4
@angular-devkit/core              8.3.4
@angular-devkit/schematics        8.3.4
@angular/cli                      8.3.4
@ngtools/webpack                  8.3.4
@schematics/angular               8.3.4
@schematics/update                0.803.4
rxjs                              6.4.0
typescript                        3.5.3
webpack                           4.39.2
**Anything else relevant?** If I run the build with the environment flag `NG_BUILD_DIFFERENTIAL_FULL` set to `1` it runs a build that does work on IE 11. Anyway, one may wonder why do I need to add a script to my application that may break it whatsoever. Well, in an ideal world, all the libraries I need would be full UMD/cmjs compatible and I may just import them as a normal vendor dependency. But sadly, that's not my case. I need to add some scripts as "global" because I'm forced to do it. My point is, this worked fine few minor versions ago and now it doesn't which in my opinion is a breaking change.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "older (es5) browsers not fully supported when using workspace scripts" (#15625)

Issues.Title: [MdSelectionList/MatListOption] Add readonly support for items
Issues.Body:
#### Feature Description

Right now only `disabled` is supported for items, which excludes the option if they were previously selected from the final result.

With `readonly`, the items wouldn't be able to be interacted with but if they were previously checked, then they make it to the final result.

#### Use Case

To have selection list with items visually stylized as readonly that cannot be checked/unchecked due some business conditions.

Reference: 

https://material.angular.io/components/list/api#MatListOption
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "[MdSelectionList/MatListOption] Add readonly support for items" (#17141)

Issues.Body:
*After the close of issue https://github.com/angular/components/issues/16780 by the bot, I allow myself to repost it because the proposed solution does not work*

**Proposal:**
Having the possibility to initialize a mat-button-toggle-group with multiple values

Exemple :
```
<mat-button-toggle-group #group="matButtonToggleGroup" value="email,phone" multiple>
                <mat-button-toggle value="email" aria-label="email">
                    <mat-icon>email</mat-icon>
                </mat-button-toggle>
                <mat-button-toggle value="phone" aria-label="phone">
                    <mat-icon>phone</mat-icon>
                </mat-button-toggle>
</mat-button-toggle-group>
```
Setting value of mat-button-toggle-group with values list

The proposed solution `[value]="['email', 'phone']"` dont work, here is a stackblitz : https://stackblitz.com/edit/angular-vr2sb8?embed=1&file=app/button-toggle-overview-example.html

Issues.Title: fix(drag-drop): unable to drop into connected sibling after scrolling into view via the parent
Issues.Body:
In #16681 we added some logic that updates the cached dimensions if the document is scrolled while dragging, however it didn't account for any scrollable parent nodes that might've been scrolled. These changes switch the event listener to use capturing so that we can pick up all of the elements being scrolled.

**Note:** this was tricky to reproduce in a test, but I've added more context in a comment with a reference to the issue that it fixes.

Fixes #17144.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open PR "fix(drag-drop): unable to drop into connected sibling after scrolling into view via the parent" (#17162)

Issues.Title: build: fix bazel devserver not launching
Issues.Body:
The custom devserver implementation does currently not
work due to a breaking change in the `rules_nodejs` repo.

Apparently a `nodejs_binary` no longer generates an executable
output without either `.bat` or `.sh`. This is something we
relied on in the devserver launcher script. The fix is as simple
as resolving the executable with `.sh` extension as we run the
devserver launcher from within a `sh_binary` already.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed or merged PR "build: fix bazel devserver not launching" (#17160)

Issues.Title: fix(drag-drop): dragging styles not reset once dragging is completed
Issues.Body:
When the user starts dragging an element we set some styles on it in order to prevent some native interactions like text selection, however we never reset them which can prevent the user from being able to start dragging from the same element afterwards.

Fixes #17139.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open PR "fix(drag-drop): dragging styles not reset once dragging is completed" (#17150)

Issues.Title: refactor: move force-stabilize from TestElement to ComponentHarness
Issues.Body:
Currently the `forceStabilize` method lives on `TestElement`. This is
not the most ergonomic place, given its intended use. This PR moves it
to the `ComponentHarness` base class so that subclasses can simply call
`await this.forceStabilize()`
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open PR "refactor: move force-stabilize from TestElement to ComponentHarness" (#17149)

Issues.Title: MatCheckbox doesn't check on mobile in certain conditions
Issues.Body:
#### Reproduction
I am not able to reproduce this on stackblitz, only in my current project.

When the viewing the page in mobile, clicking on the checkboxes causes the ripple effect on the background but does not check the checkbox.

1. Open https://test.aryv.com/checkbox-test either on a mobile device, or set chrome to a device through dev tool and reload. The page must be loaded with chrome set to a mobile device.

2. Click on the checkbox
 
#### Expected Behavior

The checkbox should be checked.

#### Actual Behavior

The ripple effect displays but the checkbox is not checked.

#### Environment
My project is currently on 7.2, but this behavior exists on 8.2 as well.
- Angular: 7.2.8, 8.2.7
- CDK/Material: 7.2, 8.2
- Browser(s): Chrome, iOS Safari
- Operating System (e.g. Windows, macOS, Ubuntu): Windows, Android, iOS
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "MatCheckbox doesn't check on mobile in certain conditions" (#17146)

Issues.Title: build: fix docs not displaying inherited members properly
Issues.Body:
Recently due to the MDC prototypes, we have multiple layers of inheritance. Apparently
our current docs tooling sometimes does not display inherited members which are coming
from implicitly inherited class-like documents.

For example: see how the `MatTabLink` docs broke when the MDC prototype
landed: https://github.com/angular/material2-docs-content/commit/338929159e4263e952e5df6a37f1ac3a9ca15885
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed or merged PR "build: fix docs not displaying inherited members properly" (#17145)

Issues.Title: cdkDropList has wrong container after scrolling
Issues.Body:
When there are multiple cdkDropLists on a page and an item from the droplist is dropped on a target container that is only visible after scrolling it into view. The container that is referenced as the target container is not the correct container.

Here is an example in on stackblitz.
https://stackblitz.com/edit/angular-xoxgw2

Steps to reproduce:

Drag an item from a visible container.
Scroll to a container that was not visible before.
drop the item on the container
Expected Behavior
The target should be dropped on the correct container

Environment
Angular: 8.2.7
CDK/Material: 8.2.0

I already mentioned this before in issue #16648 . But after upgrading to version 8.2.0 with a fix  #16681  the problem still occurs as shown in the [example](https://stackblitz.com/edit/angular-xoxgw2) on stackblitz
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "cdkDropList has wrong container after scrolling" (#17144)

Issues.Title: Nested drop targets do not work correctly.
Issues.Body:
Let's assume we take the example from the guide at https://material.angular.io/cdk/drag-drop/overview below the header "Transferring items between lists".

Here we have a div having the attribute [cdkDropListConnectedTo]="[todoList]".

We now do a very simple change, we edit that div and make a small hierarchy of drop targets by putting three divs inside each other, where they each have the attribute [cdkDropListConnectedTo]="[todoList]".

Now we should be able to drag items from the todoList and drop the items at any of the three divs making up the hierarchy.

Unfortunately it's always the outermost div which get's the drop and not the one below the mouse cursor. So, for example, if you drag an item from the todoList and release the mouse button above the innermost div, it's still the outer-most div, which gets the drop.

Shouldn't it rather be the div below the mouse pointer and not the outermost div?

I hope you may fix this, because it's rather difficult to drop at nodes in a hierarchy having the current behavior.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "Nested drop targets do not work correctly." (#17143)

Issues.Title: cdk/DragDropModule cdkDropList cdkDragStartDelay breaks scrolling after first drag
Issues.Body:
#### Bug, feature request, or proposal:
Bug

#### What is the expected behavior?
Holding click/touch on draggable item for less than x seconds allows you to scroll by normally on touch device. Holding click/touch for x seconds or more triggers drag action for draggable item.

#### What is the current behavior?
It works as intended until an item is dragged for the first time. After dragging a draggable item, it no longer registers a click for scrolling. the item can still be moved after holding the click for x seconds, but it doesn't allow scroll. You can still scroll if you start the click event on a different draggable item that hasn't been moved yet.

#### What are the steps to reproduce?
https://stackblitz.com/edit/angular-wzhhco

1. F12 to open chrome dev tools and toggle device toolbar to allow simulated mobile touch-scroll
2. quickly click and drag any of the test items in the draggable list to see it scrolls as intended
3. click and hold any of the test items for 200 milliseconds and drag to reposition
4. repeat step 2 on the same item you moved in step 3 to see it no longer scrolls
5. repeat step 2 on any item you haven't dragged to see it only appears to affect items which have moved


#### What is the use-case or motivation for changing an existing behavior?
It doesn't really work if it only works once

#### Which versions of Angular, Material, OS, TypeScript, browsers are affected?
For sure 8.2+, not sure beyond that.

#### Is there anything else we should know?
I noticed this error sporadically when trying to scroll the already-moved item:

> drag-drop-registry.ts:199 [Intervention] Ignored attempt to cancel a touchmove event with cancelable=false, for example because scrolling is in progress and cannot be interrupted.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "cdk/DragDropModule cdkDropList cdkDragStartDelay breaks scrolling after first drag" (#17139)
